Career Services welcomes both new students as well as those returning to complete their education PERIOD

While attending classes completing assignments and engaging in the activities that make up college life you should take advantage of the opportunity to prepare for the world of work PERIOD Career preparation is as vital to you as good grades and a social life PERIOD

Graduation will come sooner than you think and Career Services can enrich your education by offering to assist you in getting work experience in the skills that employers seek PERIOD Those skills are verbal and written communication teamwork and interpersonal skills PERIOD Other talents that you can bring to an employer are honesty and a strong work ethic PERIOD

Whether you are a freshman upperclassman or graduate student Career Services can assist you in getting experiences in career development activities such as cooperative education internships part and fulltime jobs resume development and online resume critiques and interviewing techniques PERIOD

There are careerrelated workshops and career fairs that provide opportunities to meet prospective employers and engage in oncampus interviews with employers PERIOD

Career Services is centrally located on campus in Room  of the Campus Life Building PERIOD Career counseling with individuals is a priority and appointments can be made by calling  PERIOD Help can also be attained during scheduled walkin hours on Tuesday and Wednesday between noon and  p.m PERIOD

Additional information can be found about career opportunities for your major in the Career Resource Center and at www.niu.educrcmajorweblink.htm PERIOD A free online job search management program is available at www.niu.educareerservices where you can activate your Victor eRecruiting account PERIOD Once your account has been activated you can research potential employers and available internships and jobs for which you can apply PERIOD

Students who plan to graduate this year should visit Career Services as soon as practical to receive the assistance necessary to find a job PERIOD There are job fairs to help land the job that meets your major PERIOD A university wide job fair is scheduled for Sept PERIOD  for those seeking permanent employment after graduation PERIOD A fair on Oct PERIOD  will be held for those seeking experience in their major or career path prior to graduation in cooperative education positions and internships PERIOD Both fairs will be held in the Convocation Center PERIOD

Volunteer opportunities and parttime jobs are also available and listed with the Job Location and Development Office PERIOD Local agencies and employers seek NIU students to participate in projects programs and special events PERIOD Participation in these activities provides students with handson work experience while helping others PERIOD

Dont procrastinate make it a point to use the many services of Career Services PERIOD

Douglas Q PERIOD Davis

Director Career Services
